headline: Federal Appeals Court Says Arizona’s Election Rules Violate the Voting Rights Act
abstract: In Arizona, where elections are getting closer, a federal appeals court undid strict limits on ballot collection and votes cast at the wrong precinct.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If a voter accidentally casts a ballot in the wrong precinct, should it be counted? Should early voters be able to give their sealed ballots to someone else to drop in the mail or deliver to a polling place?
